book_level.description: Upper elementary level - humorous diary-style narrative about middle school life, social dynamics, and family

questions.question: What does Greg insist his book should be called?

options.A: A journal, not a diary
options.B: A notebook for school
options.C: A secret logbook
options.D: A memoir of his life

questions.explanation: Greg says 'This is a journal, not a diary' because he thinks diaries are for girls.

questions.question: Who is Greg's best friend?

options.A: Bryce Anderson
options.B: Rowley Jefferson
options.C: Fregley
options.D: Chirag Gupta

questions.explanation: Rowley Jefferson is Greg's best friend, though Greg says their friendship is 'subject to change.'

questions.question: What is the name of Greg's older brother?

options.A: Manny
options.B: Charlie
options.C: Roderick
options.D: Bryce

questions.explanation: Roderick is Greg's older brother who plays drums in a heavy metal band.

questions.question: What is the name of Roderick's band?

options.A: Heavy Thunder
options.B: Metal Madness
options.C: Rock Solid
options.D: Loaded Diaper

questions.explanation: Roderick's band is called Loaded Diaper, spelled L-O-D-E-D-D-I-P-E-R on his van.

questions.question: What nickname does Manny call Greg?

options.A: Buddy
options.B: Bubby
options.C: Greggy
options.D: Brother

questions.explanation: Manny calls Greg 'Bubby' because he couldn't pronounce 'brother' when he was a baby.

questions.question: Who started the Cheese Touch at school?

options.A: Darren Walsh
options.B: Greg Heffley
options.C: Rowley Jefferson
options.D: Abe Hall

questions.explanation: Darren Walsh touched the moldy cheese with his finger, starting the Cheese Touch.

questions.question: How can you protect yourself from the Cheese Touch?

options.A: Wear special gloves
options.B: Run away quickly
options.C: Cross your fingers
options.D: Touch a tree

questions.explanation: The only way to protect yourself from the Cheese Touch is to cross your fingers.

questions.question: Who is the most popular boy in Greg's grade?

options.A: Greg Heffley
options.B: Rowley Jefferson
options.C: Ronnie McCoy
options.D: Bryce Anderson

questions.explanation: Bryce Anderson is the most popular boy in Greg's grade.

questions.question: What position does Greg run for in student government?

options.A: Treasurer
options.B: Vice President
options.C: President
options.D: Secretary

questions.explanation: Greg runs for treasurer because he figures nobody cares about that position.

questions.question: What is Greg's favorite holiday?

options.A: Christmas Day
options.B: Halloween
options.C: Thanksgiving
options.D: Easter

questions.explanation: Halloween is Greg's favorite holiday.

questions.question: What does Fregley say when he needs to go to the bathroom?

options.A: Water! Water!
options.B: Potty! Potty!
options.C: Juice! Juice!
options.D: Help! Help!

questions.explanation: Fregley says 'Juice! Juice!' when he needs the bathroom, and the teachers keep bringing him juice.

questions.question: What book means you're in the easy reading group?

options.A: Einstein as a Child
options.B: Science for Smart Kids
options.C: Advanced Reading Today
options.D: Bink Says Boo

questions.explanation: If students get 'Bink Says Boo,' they're in the easy reading group.

questions.question: What did Greg's dad hide in on Halloween night?

options.A: The bushes with water
options.B: The garage with a hose
options.C: The basement stairs
options.D: Behind the front door

questions.explanation: Dad hides in the bushes with a big trash can full of water to drench teenagers.

questions.question: Who took the Cheese Touch to California?

options.A: Abe Hall
options.B: Greg Heffley
options.C: Rowley Jefferson
options.D: Darren Walsh

questions.explanation: Abe Hall got the Cheese Touch and moved away to California, taking it with him.

questions.question: What grade did Greg get in handwriting class?

options.A: An A
options.B: A B
options.C: A C
options.D: A D

questions.explanation: Greg got a D in handwriting because he taped his fingers together to stay crossed.

questions.question: Where does Fregley live?

options.A: Right next door to Greg's house
options.B: Halfway between Greg and Rowley
options.C: Next to the school building
options.D: Across town from Greg's place

questions.explanation: Fregley lives halfway between Greg's house and Rowley's house.

questions.question: What sport determined popularity in elementary school?

options.A: Playing basketball
options.B: Playing football
options.C: Playing soccer
options.D: Running the fastest

questions.explanation: In elementary school, if you were the fastest runner, you got all the girls.

questions.question: What does Greg's mom always say about him?

options.A: He's lazy and careless
options.B: He's very athletic
options.C: He's smart but doesn't apply himself
options.D: He's very artistic

questions.explanation: Mom always says Greg is a smart kid but just doesn't apply himself.

questions.question: What video game does Rowley have that Greg always plays?

options.A: Twisted Wizard game
options.B: Formula One Racing
options.C: Wacky Dog game
options.D: Super Fighter game

questions.explanation: Greg plays Formula One Racing at Rowley's because violent games aren't allowed there.

questions.question: What did the first kid pay to enter Greg's haunted house?

options.A: Two dollars
options.B: One dollar
options.C: Five dollars
options.D: Fifty cents

questions.explanation: Greg charged 2 dollars even though the flyer said 50 cents, calling it a typo.

questions.question: According to Greg, in middle school you have to be careful where you sit on the first day because _____.

options.A: your seat becomes permanent for the year
options.B: the popular kids will make fun of you
options.C: the windows are too bright in some areas
options.D: teachers move students around constantly

questions.explanation: Greg warns that wherever you sit on the first day becomes your permanent seat for the year.

questions.question: Roderick tricked Greg at the beginning of summer by _____.

options.A: hiding all his video games in the basement
options.B: making him think he slept through summer
options.C: telling him that school was cancelled all year
options.D: pretending their parents went on vacation

questions.explanation: Roderick woke Greg up at 3 AM, dressed in school clothes, and made him think it was the first day of school.

questions.question: Greg taped his fingers together because _____.

options.A: he broke his finger playing sports at school
options.B: it was a popular trend among cool kids
options.C: he wanted to stay protected from Cheese Touch
options.D: he was copying what Rowley did at school

questions.explanation: Greg taped his fingers together so they'd stay crossed all the time to protect from the Cheese Touch.

questions.question: Greg was disappointed to be in the gifted reading group because _____.

options.A: his friends were all in the easy group
options.B: the teacher of that class was very strict
options.C: the books they read were way too boring
options.D: it meant a lot of extra work for him

questions.explanation: Greg was disappointed because being in the gifted group just means a lot of extra work.

questions.question: When Greg plays Formula One Racing with Rowley, he wins easily by _____.

options.A: using cheat codes he found online
options.B: practicing more hours than Rowley does
options.C: naming his car something ridiculous
options.D: using a better controller than Rowley

questions.explanation: Greg names his car something ridiculous, and Rowley falls to pieces when the announcer says it.

questions.question: Rowley got in trouble with Greg because on the first day of school, he asked Greg to _____.

options.A: carry his heavy books to class for him
options.B: 'play' instead of using 'hang out'
options.C: sit next to him during lunch time
options.D: share his food with him at lunchtime

questions.explanation: Rowley asked to 'play' instead of 'hang out,' which embarrassed Greg in middle school.

questions.question: Mrs. Craig confiscated the CD player and lectured the boys because she thought _____.

options.A: rock and roll is evil and ruins brains
options.B: they stole it from another student's locker
options.C: they were skipping their classes to listen
options.D: the music volume was much way too loud

questions.explanation: Mrs. Craig lectured them about how rock and roll is evil and will ruin their brains.

questions.question: Greg got in trouble for listening to Roderick's CD because _____.

options.A: he played it way too late at night time
options.B: headphones were unplugged so speakers played
options.C: Roderick caught him with it in his room
options.D: Mom found the CD hidden in his backpack

questions.explanation: Greg didn't have the headphones plugged into the stereo, so the music came through the speakers.

questions.question: Roderick had to answer Mom's questions as punishment because _____.

options.A: he failed an important test at school
options.B: he broke Greg's favorite video game system
options.C: Manny brought his magazine to daycare
options.D: he stayed out way too late at night

questions.explanation: Manny took Roderick's magazine with a woman in a bikini to daycare for show and tell.

questions.question: Greg's campaign posters were taken down by the vice principal because _____.

options.A: they had too many spelling mistakes
options.B: they were hung in the wrong place
options.C: they contained false claims about the other candidate
options.D: they were way too big for the walls

questions.explanation: Mr. Roy said you weren't allowed to write fabrications about other candidates.

questions.question: At the Crossland haunted house, Mom made the chainsaw guy stop chasing the boys by _____.

options.A: calling the police on him
options.B: telling him 'That's not nice'
options.C: threatening to report him to management
options.D: paying him extra money to leave

questions.explanation: Mom stepped in and said 'That's not nice,' and the chainsaw guy apologized and showed them the exit.

questions.question: Greg and Rowley's haunted house had to close because _____.

options.A: Shane hid and Rowley's dad found them
options.B: they completely ran out of all supplies
options.C: too many kids complained to their parents
options.D: it started raining really hard outside

questions.explanation: Shane curled up under the bed in fear, and when Rowley's dad came down, he shut down the operation.

questions.question: When Rowley was grounded from TV, Greg tried to help by _____.

options.A: doing a play-by-play of the show over the phone
options.B: recording all the shows for Rowley to watch later
options.C: writing detailed summaries of each episode
options.D: sneaking a small TV into Rowley's room

questions.explanation: Greg turned on Rowley's favorite show and did a play-by-play over the phone.

questions.question: Greg thinks Dad would dismantle his game system, but he can't because _____.

options.A: Mom won't let him touch Greg's stuff
options.B: Greg hides it in a secret location
options.C: Roderick protects it from being touched
options.D: the people who make them make them parent-proof

questions.explanation: Greg says the people who make game systems make them parent-proof.

questions.question: Greg ranks himself around 52nd or 53rd in popularity, but expects to move up because _____.

options.A: he's getting cool new clothes soon
options.B: Rowley is planning to move away
options.C: Charlie Davies above him is getting braces
options.D: he just joined the soccer team

questions.explanation: Greg figures he'll move up because Charlie Davies is getting braces next week.

questions.question: The game Greg invented with the CD player headphones involved _____.

options.A: listening to music and guessing the song title
options.B: passing the headphones around as quickly as possible
options.C: dancing while wearing headphones on your head
options.D: shaking headphones off without using hands

questions.explanation: The game was to put headphones on and shake them off in the shortest time without using hands.

questions.question: Greg learned from Roderick to set people's expectations low so that _____.

options.A: nobody ever asks you for any help at all
options.B: teachers will leave you completely alone
options.C: you don't have to do any homework at all
options.D: you surprise them by doing almost nothing

questions.explanation: Greg learned to set expectations low so you end up surprising people by practically doing nothing.

questions.question: When Greg messes up in front of Dad, the best time to do it is when Dad is _____.

options.A: reading the paper quietly
options.B: watching his favorite TV show
options.C: eating dinner with the family
options.D: working out in the yard

questions.explanation: Good time to screw up is when Dad is reading the paper; bad time is when he's laying bricks.

questions.question: Greg sneaks violent video games to Rowley's house by _____.

options.A: hiding them deep inside his backpack
options.B: telling Rowley's dad they're educational
options.C: putting his disc in Manny's game case
options.D: borrowing Rowley's games instead of his

questions.explanation: Greg puts his game disc in Manny's Discovering the Alphabet case to get past Rowley's dad.

questions.question: After running through the neighbor's sprinkler, Greg's trick backfired because _____.

options.A: Dad knew right away he was faking
options.B: he caught a really bad cold
options.C: his clothes got completely ruined
options.D: Mom saw him and made him take a shower

questions.explanation: The trick worked on Dad, but Mom saw him and made him go upstairs and take a shower.

questions.question: Why does Greg say writing in the journal will 'come in handy' when he's rich and famous?

options.A: He won't have to answer people's stupid questions
options.B: His fans will all want to read it
options.C: It will help him remember his childhood better
options.D: He can sell it for a lot of money

questions.explanation: Greg says when he's rich and famous, he'll have better things to do than answer questions, so the book will come in handy.

questions.question: What does Greg's attitude toward Rowley reveal about his character?

options.A: He is a loyal friend who truly cares about Rowley
options.B: He sees friendship partly as a way to benefit himself
options.C: He doesn't care about popularity at all
options.D: He values Rowley above everyone else in his life

questions.explanation: Greg uses Rowley for pranks, criticizes his popularity rank, and says their friendship is 'subject to change.'

questions.question: Why is it ironic that Greg was disappointed to be in the gifted reading group?

options.A: He actually loves reading more than anyone else
options.B: The gifted group actually has less homework
options.C: He acted stupid but Mom got him placed anyway
options.D: Rowley is also in the gifted group with him

questions.explanation: Greg deliberately tried to act stupid during screening, but his mom is tight with the principal and probably got him placed in gifted anyway.

questions.question: What does the Cheese Touch represent in the social world of Greg's school?

options.A: A fun game that everyone at school enjoys
options.B: The importance of good personal hygiene
options.C: A great way to make new friends at school
options.D: How social status changes through random rules

questions.explanation: The Cheese Touch shows how arbitrary social rules can instantly make someone an outcast, like Abe Hall who nobody would go near.

questions.question: What does Greg's description of middle school mixing kids who 'haven't hit their growth spurt with gorillas who shave twice a day' suggest?

options.A: Physical differences create unfair social dynamics
options.B: He wants to transfer to a completely different school
options.C: He thinks the school should separate grades differently
options.D: He really admires the bigger kids in his school

questions.explanation: Greg points out how unfair it is that physical development differences create bullying problems in middle school.

questions.question: Why does Greg think Dad 'doesn't understand the concept of Halloween'?

options.A: Dad doesn't like eating any candy at all
options.B: Dad uses Halloween to drench teenagers instead of giving candy
options.C: Dad never wears any kind of costume
options.D: Dad always goes to bed really early

questions.explanation: While other parents hand out candy, Dad hides in the bushes to drench teenagers with water.

questions.question: What does the contrast between Mom's and Dad's punishment styles reveal?

options.A: Mom is much stricter than Dad overall
options.B: They always agree on how to punish the kids
options.C: Dad reacts immediately but cools off, while Mom waits and surprises you
options.D: Neither parent is very effective at discipline

questions.explanation: Dad gets mad but cools off quick; Mom takes days to decide, making you do nice things, then surprises you with punishment.

questions.question: Why is it significant that Bryce Anderson used to say 'girls are stinky poos' but is now the most popular boy?

options.A: It shows girls at school have bad memories
options.B: It proves that being mean makes you popular
options.C: It shows Bryce changed his personality completely
options.D: Popularity rules change unfairly over the years

questions.explanation: Greg points out how popularity used to be about being fast, but now it's about looks and money - and he doesn't get credit for always liking girls.

questions.question: What does Greg's haunted house scheme reveal about his entrepreneurial thinking?

options.A: He's very creative but doesn't follow through on his plans
options.B: He's honest in all his business dealings with people
options.C: He always puts customers first in everything
options.D: He has no interest in making money at all

questions.explanation: Greg had elaborate plans (sharks, acid lakes) but only finished the Hall of Screams and a ketchup pool, showing big ideas but poor execution.

questions.question: Why does Greg describe Rowley's 'How to Make Friends' book gimmicks as 'dumb' but still become his friend?

options.A: The gimmicks actually worked on Greg without him realizing
options.B: He felt sorry for Rowley and saw him as someone he could use
options.C: Rowley's mom made them become friends with each other
options.D: They discovered they had all the same interests

questions.explanation: Greg says he 'felt sorry for Rowley' and decided to 'take him under my wing' - and that it's great because he can use Roderick's tricks on him.

questions.question: What does Greg's claim that he's 'super good at video games' and could 'beat anyone' reveal about his self-image?

options.A: He's very humble about all his abilities
options.B: He's actually a professional level gamer
options.C: He overestimates himself and values skills adults don't appreciate
options.D: He never exaggerates about anything

questions.explanation: Greg thinks highly of his gaming skills despite Dad not appreciating them, showing he values things differently than adults.

questions.question: Why is Mom dancing to Roderick's heavy metal music ironic?

options.A: She's actually a really great dancer herself
options.B: She used to be in a rock band herself
options.C: Roderick taught her all the dance moves
options.D: She thinks all music is the same, missing the point

questions.explanation: Mom doesn't understand that heavy metal is supposed to be rebellious - to her 'all music is the same,' which bugs Roderick.

questions.question: What does Greg's campaign poster strategy reveal about his approach to competition?

options.A: He tries to win by tearing down opponents rather than promoting himself
options.B: He's very honest in all his dealings with people
options.C: He focuses on promoting his own strengths honestly
options.D: He doesn't really care about winning at all

questions.explanation: Greg's posters attacked Marty Porter (head lice, dropping money) instead of promoting his own qualifications.

questions.question: What theme does the story of Ronnie McCoy illustrate about growing up?

options.A: Athletic ability always matters no matter what
options.B: What makes you popular as a child doesn't guarantee success later
options.C: Running is the most important skill to have
options.D: Elementary school is harder than middle school

questions.explanation: Ronnie was popular in elementary school for being fast, but now kids like him are 'scratching their heads wondering what happened.'

questions.question: Why does Greg compare being stuck with Manny's potty routine to losing his appetite?

options.A: He doesn't like the breakfast foods Mom makes
options.B: Manny's food always tastes really bad
options.C: Scraping cereal from a toilet-like object is disgusting even if sanitary
options.D: He's trying to go on a diet

questions.explanation: Greg says if Mom had to scrape cornflakes out of a plastic potty every morning, she wouldn't have much appetite either.

questions.question: What does Greg's numerical ranking of popularity (52nd or 53rd) suggest about middle school social dynamics?

options.A: Everyone at school knows their exact popularity
options.B: Teachers officially assign popularity ranks
options.C: Only the top 10 kids actually matter at school
options.D: Greg obsessively measures social status

questions.explanation: Greg treats popularity like a precise ranking system, even tracking when he might move up a spot due to someone's braces.

questions.question: Why does Rowley's crying about 'rock and roll ruining his brains' frustrate Greg?

options.A: Rowley takes things literally and doesn't understand when adults overreact
options.B: Greg actually agrees with what Mrs. Craig said
options.C: Rowley is being way too loud about it
options.D: Rowley broke the CD player while crying

questions.explanation: Greg says 'sometimes I don't know about that boy' - Rowley believed Mrs. Craig's exaggeration literally.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'Let's you and me have a talk, friend' reveal about Dad's communication style?

options.A: Dad is always friendly even when he's angry
options.B: Dad uses 'friend' sarcastically to signal Greg is in trouble
options.C: Dad wants to have a casual friendly conversation
options.D: Dad forgot what Greg's name is

questions.explanation: Greg learned that when Dad says 'friend' that way, 'you know you're in trouble' - it's sarcasm.

questions.question: What does Greg raising the haunted house price from 50 cents to 2 dollars reveal about him?

options.A: He's a very generous person overall
options.B: He made an honest mistake on the flyer
options.C: He's opportunistic and willing to deceive customers for profit
options.D: He didn't want anyone to actually come

questions.explanation: Greg saw a 'chance to make a killing' and lied that the 50 cent price was a typo, showing opportunism.

questions.question: What is the overall message about Greg's view of himself versus how others might see him?

options.A: Greg is exactly as cool as he thinks he is
options.B: Greg is very self-aware about his flaws
options.C: Greg has really low self-esteem
options.D: Greg sees himself as smarter and more deserving than his situation reflects

questions.explanation: Greg believes he'll be 'rich and famous,' ranks his popularity precisely, and thinks he's super skilled at games - but his schemes often fail and he's stuck in middle school like everyone else.
